_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OUR COMPANY IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN GRAIN STORAGE FOR AREA PRODUCERS AS WELL AS PROVIDING THE NECESSARY INPUTS FOR GRAIN PRODUCTION.   THIS COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE.  OUR FARMER OWNERS, MANAGERS AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

OUR PLANT CONSIST OFTHREE 33,000 GALLON ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE TANK AND WHEN FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY WILL HOLD APPROXIMATELY 468,000 POUNDS.  WITH THE ADDITION OF NO MORE THAN 100 NURSE TANKS WITH A CAPACITY OF 440,000 POUNDS AND POSSIBLY THREE RAILCARS WITH A CAPACITY OF 468,000 POUNDS  MAKES THE COMPANY?S TOTAL CAPACITY OF 1,376,000 POUNDS.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO MAY POTENTIALLY RELEASE 156,000 POUNDS (OVER A TEN MINUTE PERIOD) AND HAS A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF2.66 MILES.  THIS RELEASE HAS THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT 1232 AREA RESIDENTS.  THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A RELEASE OF 11,908 POUNDS OVER A 2?MINUTE RELEASE PERIOD.  THIS RELEASE WOULD HAVE A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .83 MILES AND WOULD AFFECT 20 PEOPLE WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.

THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR NH3 PLANT IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.  THE NEBRASKA STATE FIRE MARSHAL INSPECTS OUR PLANT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENT.  THOSE CHANGES OR IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE ACTED UPON IMMEDIATELY TO REDUCE POTENTIAL AMMONIA RELEASES.  OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, PROPER PLANT OPERATION, PLANT MAINTENANCE AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL.  EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF SAFETY WATER DURING NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS. 

WITH THE ABOVE MENTIONED TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY SIMPLE TO REPORT TO YOU THAT ABSOLUTELY NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY RESPO

NSE PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RISKS TO EMPLOYEES, THE SURROUNDING PUBLIC AND THE AREA FIRST RESPONDERS.  THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE COUNTY LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMISSION (LEPC).  THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF NH3 AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
